text:
The tenement was granted to Gindalbie Metals Ltd., formerly Gindalbie Gold N.L., 
 on the 26th of April 2006, for a period of 5 years, expiring on the 25th of April 2011. 
 E59/987 is managed by Monarch Gold Mining Company Ltd. 
 During  the  2006/07  reporting  period,  Gindalbie  Metals  Ltd.  conducted  a  review 
 and  recompilation  of  existing  geological,  geochemical  and  geophysical  data  as 
 part of a gold and base metal target generation and ranking exercise, to evaluate 
 the area prior to sale. Monarch Gold Mining Company Ltd. continued the review 
 and targeting during the reporting period.

6.text: E59/987 is situated within the Muralgarra Pastoral Lease.

text:
E59/987 is situated within the Muralgarra Pastoral Lease. 
 Access  to  the  project  is  via  the  Yalgoo  - Warriedar gravel road, and then along 
 station tracks and fences lines.

text:
Murchison  Supergroup,  are  identified  within  the  area.  The  conglomerates,  lithic 
 arenites  and  shales  of  the  Mougooderra  Formation  unconformably  overlie  the 
 BIF,  chert  and  felsic  volcanic,  volcaniclastic  and  volcanogenic  units  of  the 
 Windaning  Formation.  The  eastern  and  western  unconformable  contacts  of  the 
 Mougooderra Formation are interpreted to be shear and/or thrust zones (Watkins 
 and Hickman, 1990, Flanagan, 2001).
